intro: Euacer pallens, commonly known as the pale euacer, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
